page.title: 10Hawarden Airport
page.content: The battle flights last combat took place on 18th September, 1940. January saw two flights of Spitfires detached to nearby Sealand and one flight to Granage in one, 2 Canadians killed in Master N.7833 which hit a house in Mill Lane Buckton, Chester. The summer of 1942 must have been Hawarden's busiest period. Hawardens third and last Battle of Britain display was held on 15th September 1956 featuring many contemporary aircraft. In 1958 rumour of the impending closure of RAF Hawarden began to circulate as major cuts in defence expenditure were in the offing.
